939.01
   701.01 DEFINITIONS.
   Words and phrases shall have the following meanings:
   (a)   "Contractor" means any person or entity that contracts or is employed
to perform any work within the City that requires a permit.  The person or
entity obtaining the permit may be the owner, occupant or resident agent of the
premises or contractor.  "Contractor" does not include a person who is an
employee of the person or entity obtaining the permit.
   (b)   "General contractor" means a contractor as defined in subsection (a)
hereof, who contracts with the owner, occupant or resident agent of the
premises.
   (c)   "Subcontractor" means a contractor who contracts with a general
contractor or other subcontractor, but who does not contract directly with the
owner, occupant or resident agent. 
   (d)   For the purposes of this chapter, "contractor" shall include both
general contractors and subcontractors.
   (e)   For the purposes of this chapter "Certificate of Contractor
Registration," "license," and "license to engage in the trades or professions"
shall have the same meaning.  (Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.02  LICENSES REQUIRED.
   No person shall engage in any of the trades, businesses or professions for
which licenses are required by Part Seven - Business Regulation Code, or by any
other ordinance or provision of this Code without first applying for and
obtaining a license from the City Manager, assignee of the City Manager, or
other duly authorized issuing authority.
(Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.03  REGISTRATION GENERALLY
   (a)   Certificate Required.  No contractor shall perform any work within the
City without a current Certificate of Contractor Registration from the City
Manager or assignee. This registration requirement applies to the following
contractors:
   Concrete/Asphalt
   Deck Installers
   Demolition
   Electrical
   Excavation/Tapping
   Fence Installers
   Fire Protection and Suppression (Commercial)
   General Contractors
   Heating/Cooling/Ventilation
   Landscaping
   Masonry
   Plumbing
   Roofing/Siding
   Sign
   (b)   Failure to Register.  Registration and/or renewal is required annually
in December to perform work in the City the following calendar year. Any
contractor who fails to register prior to performing work, and continues to
perform work in the City that requires a permit, will be in violation of this
Chapter.  Any contractor, who is found to be performing work without a license
in violation of this Chapter, will be notified by the City Manager or
assignee.  Such contractor must register within ten days of notification and
will be charged an additional administrative fee of twice the registration
cost, as specified in Section 701.06 herein.  (Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
 
   701.04  APPLICATION; REQUIREMENTS; ISSUANCE; DATE AND DURATION.
   (a)   Application.  An application for a Certificate of Contractor
Registration shall be filed each year with the City Manager or assignee.  No
certificate shall be issued to any person knowingly making a false statement or
misrepresentation in the application.
An application may be filed no sooner than December 1 of the year preceding the
period of registration.
   (b)   Requirements. Contractors must provide proof of insurance before they
may be licensed. All original applications for licenses, unless otherwise
specifically provided, shall be made in writing upon forms to be furnished by
the City Manager or assignee and shall contain:
      (1)   The name, address, and business telephone number, and federal tax
identification number of the applicant, type of ownership (i.e. sole
proprietorship, partnership, or corporation) and the responsible parties for
payroll certifications and legal notification.
      (2)   Contractors providing HVAC, sprinklers, plumbing, electrical, or
underground fire service line services must also provide a copy of their
current license from the state of Ohio.
      (3)   The names of municipalities within the County of Stark or
contiguous counties where the applicant has done work.
   (c)   Issuance.  Upon receipt of application for the certificate of
registration, and compliance with the requirements the City Manager, following
verification of the requirements, shall deposit the fee into the appropriate
account for the City and issue to the applicant a proper certificate signed by
the City Manager. 
   (d)   Date and Duration.  A license shall not be valid beyond the expiration
date therein specified and, unless otherwise provided, shall not extend beyond
December 31 for the year issued. Licenses may be renewed annually at the
renewal rate before January 1 upon application made to the City Manager or
other issuing authority and payment of the prescribed fee. Applications
submitted after January 1 will be charged for the full annual license fee.
Unless otherwise specified, the full annual license fee will be required of
licensees irrespective of the date of issue of such license.
   (e)   Renewal of an annual license may be granted to a licensee in good
standing upon the original application, unless otherwise provided.  With each
original or renewal application, the applicant shall deposit the fee required
for the license requested.
      (1)   Liability insurance certificate with coverage limit of not less
than one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence for personal bodily injury
and property damage.
      (2)   Workers Compensation Insurance Certificate.
         (Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.05  DISPLAY; TRANSFERABILITY; REVOCATION; SUSPENSION.
   (a)   Display.  Every licensee conducting business at a fixed location shall
display the license certificate in a prominent place upon the licensed
premises. Other licensees shall carry their license certificates at all times
and shall exhibit the same whenever requested by any officer or citizen.
   (b)   Transferability.  A license shall be valid only for the person or
entity appearing on the license and only for the conduct of the business and at
the place designated thereon. A license shall not be assignable or
transferable.
   (c)   Revocation.  The license may be revoked and canceled by the City
Manager or Board of Building Appeals at any time for neglect or refusal to
comply with any of the ordinances, rules, regulations, and governing laws;
provided, however, that such license shall be revoked only after due notice by
personal service or by regular mail to the address of the license holder
provided on application of registration or last renewal of the license, fixing
the time and place of hearing by the Board of Building Appeals. Revocation
shall become effective upon notice served upon the licensee or posted upon the
premises affected.
   (d)   Suspension.  As a preliminary to revocation, the City Manager or
assignee may issue an order suspending the license, which shall become
effective immediately and served upon the contractor personal service or by
regular mail sent to the address of the license holder at the address provided
on the application for registration or the last renewal of the license. Notice
shall specify the reason for suspension, and may provide conditions under which
reinstatement of the license may be obtained. Upon compliance with such stated
conditions within the time specified, the license may be restored.
(Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.06  FEES.
   See Chapter
159 Fees and Charges.
(Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.07  EXCEPTIONS.
   This Chapter shall not apply to a homeowner who acts as his or her own
general contractor; provided, however:
   (a)   Each subcontractor of the homeowner shall be registered in accordance
with the above sections.
   (b)   The homeowner shall submit an affidavit to the City Building Official
identifying any subcontractor who will be performing construction services.
   (c)   The homeowner's work shall comply with the applicable Building Code,
ordinance, rule and regulation, and shall be inspected prior to being concealed
or completed.
   (d)   This Chapter shall not apply to a commercial, industrial, or rental
property owner who acts as his or her own general contractor provided such
owner:
      (1)   Conforms with subsection (a), (b) and (c) above; and
      (2)   Shall use electricians, plumbers, HVAC, and sprinkler contractors
who are registered with City.
   (e)   This Chapter shall not apply to any public utility company or its
employees engaged in the manufacture, transmission or distribution of
electrical energy for commercial purposes or any persons primarily engaged in
the business of transmission of signals, communications or intelligence, is not
an "electrical contractor" and is exempt from registration fees for installing,
altering or extending electrical wiring which is for the exclusive use of
manufacturing, transmitting or distributing electrical energy, subject to the
limitations stated in the City's Building Code.  (Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-
15.)
   701.08  APPEAL.
   (a)   In case any applicant has been denied a license, or if their license
has been revoked or suspended, the applicant or licensee, as the case may be,
shall be granted an automatic appeal to City Council from the denial,
revocation or suspension. Notice of the appeal date shall be given to the
applicant or licensee a minimum of 5 days before the hearing. Any applicant who
does not attend their appeal hearing, or notify City Council in writing that
they will be unable to attend, shall be deemed to have waived their appeal. The
Deputy City Clerk shall notify all members of City Council of the time and
place of such hearing. Three members of City Council shall constitute a quorum
to hear such appeal. The appellant may appear and be heard in person or by a
self-designated council. If, after the hearing, a majority of all members of
City Council declare in favor of the applicant, the license shall forthwith be
issued or fully reinstated, as the case may be; otherwise the order appealed
from shall become final.
   (b)   Appeal of this suspension may be perfected by submitting a written
notice within 10 days of the issuance of the suspension served upon City
Council through its Clerk, 215 South Mill Street, Louisville, Ohio 44641. City
Council shall set a time and place for a hearing on the issue of the
suspension.  The license will remain suspended during the review process. 
(Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)
   701.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which an offense occurs or continues. A single citation
may cover more than one day or violation. Challenge of the citation for a
violation of this chapter may be before the Canton Municipal Court or
transferred to said Court upon request.
(Ord. 15-48.  Passed 12-21-15.)

Community Antenna Television and the receipt, transmission and distribution of
voices, sound, signals, pictures, visual images or any other type of closed
circuit transmission or signal transmission by means of electrical impulses.

be a public utility when operated or to be operated within the City.

electric currents and/or electrical impulses in, over, under or across any

CHAPTER 707
Cable Television Rates
707.01   General provisions.
707.02   Rules and procedures.
707.03   Review of rates and rate changes; costs.
707.04   Applicability of requirements.
   707.01  GENERAL PROVISIONS.
   All rates and charges for basic cable service and any other cable
programming services, as defined by the 1992 Cable Act and applicable FCC
regulations, shall, to the extent permissible, be subject to regulation by the
City in a manner provided by this chapter.  This chapter shall apply to all
cable television system operators in the City.  The Grantee and/or any other
operator of a cable television system operating in the City shall be subject to
the rate regulation provisions provided for herein, and those of the FCC at 47
C.F.R., Part 76, Subpart N.
   The City reserves the right to amend this chapter from time to time
consistent with the requirements of the FCC, and state and federal law.
(Ord.  00-16.  Passed 3-20-00.)
   707.02  RULES AND PROCEDURES.
   (a)   The City hereby adopts and shall follow the rules relating to cable
rate regulation promulgated by the FCC at 47 C.F.R., Part 76, Subpart N.  Prior
to approving or disapproving any rates, the City shall provide an opportunity
for consideration of the views of interested parties.
   (b)   Upon adoption of this chapter, the City Clerk will send to the Grantee
and each operator of a cable television system in the City, via certified mail,
return receipt requested, a written notice, which shall include a copy of this
chapter and notice that the City is certified by the FCC to regulate the cable
television rates authorized by this chapter.
   (c)   Within thirty days after receipt of the aforesaid notice, the Grantee
and any other cable television operator shall have thirty days to file its rate
schedule and justification for rates for the basic service tier and associated
equipment using the appropriate official FCC forms.
      (1)   If the existing rates and/or any subsequent rate increases are
within the FCC standards, the rates will be effective thirty days after
submission.
      (2)   Except in the case of an FCC Form 1240 - “Annual Update Form”
filing, if the City is unable to determine whether the rate at issue is within
the FCC’s standards, based on the material before it, or if the Grantee or any
other cable operator has submitted a cost-of-service showing seeking to justify
a rate above the FCC’s reasonable rate level, the City may take an additional
period of time to make a final determination and toll the effective date of the
proposed rates for a commensurate period.
         A.   The City make take an additional ninety days if it needs more
time to ensure that a rate is within the FCC’s rate standards.
         B.   The City make take an additional 150 days to evaluate a cost-of-
service showing seeking to justify a rate above the reasonable rate level.
         C.   The City must issue a brief written decision regarding its
invocation of the additional time period.  This written decision shall be
prepared by the City Manager or his designee.
         D.   If the City has availed itself of additional time under
paragraphs A.  or B.  of this paragraph and is still unable to determine if the
rate at issue is within the FCC’s standards, then it may preserve its right to
rule, and order a refund if necessary, by issuing a brief order directing the
Grantee, or any other cable operator in the City, to keep an accurate account
of all amounts received by reason of the rate at issue and on whose behalf such
amounts were paid.  Such order shall be issued by the City Manager, or his
designee.
      (3)   Where the Grantee, or any other cable operator, files an FCC Form
1240 - “Annual Update Form”, the filing must be made at least ninety days
before a rate change is to be implemented and the City shall have ninety days
from the date of the filing to review it.
         A.   If the City is unable to determine whether the rate at issue is
within the FCC’s standards during the ninety-day review period and has taken no
action, then the proposed rate(s) may go into effect at the end of the review
period, subject to a prospective rate reduction and a refund of all amounts
received by reason of the rate at issue if the City issues a written decision
disapproving any portion of such rates within twelve months of the Form’s
filing date.
         B.   If the Grantee, or any other cable operator in the City inquires
in writing during the review period as to whether the City intends to issue a
rate order after the review period, the City must notify the operator of its
intent in this regard within fifteen days of receipt of such written inquiry in
order for the City to preserve its right to order a prospective rate reduction
and refund.
      (4)   The City may issue a written decision to approve a rate schedule,
but in all cases in which a rate schedule is being disapproved, a written
decision shall be issued by the City.
      (5)   If rates are in excess of the FCC’s standards, the rates may be
reduced and/or refunds may be ordered by the City pursuant to applicable FCC
regulations.
   (d)   After the initial rate schedule procedures are followed, as described
in this section, the Grantee and/or any other cable operator shall, in
conjunction with each change in the rates and charges applicable to basic cable
service, conform to the standards of the FCC.  Before any rate change is
effective, the Grantee and/or any other cable operator shall notify the City of
its requested rate change by giving the City at least thirty days advance
written notice before the change is effective and by providing the City with
its rates and applicable information pursuant to FCC regulations.
   (e)   To the extent specifically permitted by federal law and applicable FCC
rules, the Grantee and/or any other cable operator shall be permitted to appeal
to the FCC for a review of the decision of the City. 
(Ord.  00-16.  Passed 3-20-00.)
   707.03  REVIEW OF RATES AND RATE CHANGES; COSTS.
   (a)   The City may utilize a rate consultant to advise it on proposed rate
changes and to assist it in the procedures and the standards for review adopted
by the FCC.  A rate consultant may be any person who has sufficient background
and experience, in the sole opinion of the City, to properly evaluate and
analyze rates and charges.
   (b)   All costs for the review of initial rates or rate changes shall be
paid by the cable operator upon demand of the City, unless contrary to
applicable rules of the FCC governing these procedures or unless otherwise
specifically preempted by state or federal law.  The costs shall include, but
not be limited to, rate consultants, attorney’s fees and the reasonable value
of services (as determined by the City) rendered by the City or any City
employees, agents or representatives of the City.
(Ord.  00-16.  Passed 3-20-00.)
   707.04  APPLICABILITY OF REQUIREMENTS.
   The requirements described in this chapter are applicable to the Grantee and
all operators of cable television systems within the City subject to rate
regulation according to the 1992 Cable Act and applicable FCC rules.
(Ord.  00-16.  Passed 3-20-00.)

CHAPTER 709
Entertainments and Shows
709.01   License required.
709.02   License application, fee, issuance.
709.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to license and regulate shows and theatrical exhibitions - see Ohio
R.C. 715.48
      License exception - see Ohio R. C. 715.63
      State licensing of portable amusement devices - see Ohio R. C. 1711.11(H)
      County show, menagerie permits - see Ohio R. C. 3765.01, 3765.02
      Disturbing a lawful meeting - see GEN. OFF.
509.04
      Noise - see GEN. OFF.
509.08
      Health, safety and sanitation regulations - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
521
      Littering - see GEN. OFF.
521.08
   709.01  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall exhibit within the City any play, show, circus, theatrical
performance, menagerie, panoramic painting, sculpture or musical entertainment
or the like, nor run a skating rink, shooting gallery, race, merry-go-round for
private gain, without first having obtained a license therefor from the City
Manager; provided that, this section shall not apply to lectures, exhibits and
the like on scientific, historical, literary or art subjects not exhibited for
private gain.
(1950 Code §245; Ord. 748. Passed 1-7-52.)
   709.02  LICENSE APPLICATION, FEE, ISSUANCE.
   The City Manager shall have authority to grant and issue a license to any
person, firm or corporation to exhibit any play, circus, theatrical
performance, menagerie, panorama, painting, sculpture, or musical
entertainment; or to run a skating rink, shooting gallery, race, merry-go-
round, for private gain. Such license shall not be issued for a period in
excess of one year. The applicant shall make application to the City Manager
stating therein his name and address, the kind of play, show, circus,
theatrical performance, menagerie, panorama, painting, sculpture, entertainment
which he proposes to operate, and shall pay a license fee of not more than
twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor less than one dollar ($1.00).
(1950 Code §245)
   709.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00).  A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which an offense occurs or continues.

CHAPTER 713
Dog Kennels
713.01   Permit; fee; requirements.
713.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Kennel owner defined - see Ohio R.C. 955.02
         Registration and fee - see Ohio R.C. 955.04
         Time limit for registration - see Ohio R.C. 955.05
         Failure to register kennel - see Ohio R.C. 955.21, 955.99
         Nuisance conditions - see GEN. OFF.
505.08
         Barking or howling dogs - see GEN. OFF.
505.09
         Noxious or offensive odors - see GEN. OFF.
521.09
   713.01  PERMIT; FEE; REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Any person desiring to own, possess or keep more than five dogs or
cats, or any combination thereof, on the premises of his residence or business
at any one time, with the exception of a litter or portion of a litter of pups
or kittens less than eight months old, shall first obtain a permit from the
City as provided for in this section and shall additionally obtain such other
licenses as may be required by the Ohio Revised Code.
(Ord. 95-16.  Passed 7-17-95.)
   (b)   Permits for keeping of dogs or cats in excess of five, or any
combination thereof, as required by this section shall be obtained from the
City, upon application to the City.  Permit applications shall be filed
annually and no later than January 31st of each year.  The original permit
application fee shall be included with the application which may be renewed
annually for an additional fee.  The application shall be made by the owner or
keeper of the dogs or cats who shall provide such information as may be
required by the City.  Upon application, the City Property Maintenance
Enforcement Department shall conduct an inspection of the permit premises to
insure that all requirements contained in subsection (c) hereof are met by each
permit applicant prior to issuance of the permit.  This permit requirement
shall be in addition to all other licensing requirements required by law.
(Ord. 05-56.  Passed 12-19-05.)
   (c)   All owners or keepers of dogs and cats in excess of five, or any
combination thereof, located within the City shall meet all of the following
requirements:
      (1)   All animals shall be maintained in a healthy condition, or, if ill,
shall be given appropriate  treatment immediately;
      (2)   The quarters in which the animals are kept shall be maintained in a
clean condition and in  a good state of repair;
      (3)   Animals pens or enclosures shall be of sufficient size in order to
provide reasonable freedom of movement to the animals contained therein;
                (4)   Food supplies shall be stored in rodent proof containers,
and food and water containers  shall be cleaned daily;
      (5)   Litter and/or bedding materials shall be changed weekly to prevent
an odor nuisance;
      (6)   Feces shall be removed from yards, pens and enclosures daily and
stored in tightly covered containers until final disposal;
      (7)   Yards, pens, premises and animals shall be kept free of insect
infestation;
      (8)   The premises shall be fenced in by adequate fencing materials to
prevent the escape of the animals and/or prevent access by the animals, either
over, under or through the fence, to adjacent properties;
      (9)   The fenced in area shall contain adequate square footage to provide
reasonably adequate exercise areas for the animals;
      (10)   The animals shall be maintained so that no unreasonably loud and
disturbing noises of such character, intensity and duration so as to disturb
the peace, quiet and good order of  the neighborhood shall be emitted from the
premises.
   (d)   Hospitals, clinics and other premises operated by licensed
veterinarians exclusively for the care and treatment of animals shall be exempt
from the provisions of this section. 
(Ord. 95-16.  Passed 7-17-95.)
   713.99  PENALTY.
   Any person who violates any provision of Section
713.01 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
(Ord. 95-16.  Passed 7-17-95.)

CHAPTER 717
Fortunetelling
717.01   License required.
717.02   License application.
717.03   Bond required.
717.04   License eligibility.
717.05   License investigation.
717.06   License termination; fee; exhibition; revocation.
717.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Business licenses not transferable - see BUS. REG.
701.03
   717.01  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall engage in the business of palmistry, phrenology or the
telling of fortunes by any manner whatever within the City unless the person
has first been duly licensed therefor in compliance with this chapter.
(Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.02  LICENSE APPLICATION.
   Every person desiring to engage in the business of palmistry, phrenology or
the telling of fortunes by any manner whatsoever must file with the City
Manager a sworn application in writing, in duplicate, on a form to be furnished
or as required by the Manager which shall give the following information:
   (a)    Name, age and physical description of the applicant.
   (b)    Permanent home address and local address.
   (c)    A description of the nature of the business and the address where the
business will be carried on.
   (d)    Applicant's former business, occupation or previous experience or
qualifications for such  palmistry, phrenology, or the telling of fortunes by
any manner whatsoever for five years prior to making the application.
   (e)    The names and addresses of at least three citizens of the City,
owning title to real estate in the City, as references regarding such previous
experience or qualification, and as to the character of the applicant, together
with a signed statement of the references certifying their knowledge of the
facts. 
   (f)   The length of time for which the right to do business is desired.
   (g)    Two copies of a photograph of the applicant, taken within sixty days
immediately prior to the  date of the filing of the application, which picture
shall be not less than two inches by two inches  showing the head and shoulders
of the applicant in a clear and distinguishing manner.
   (h)    The fingerprints of the applicant and evidence as to the good
character and business responsibility of the applicant as will enable an
investigator to properly evaluate such character and business responsibility.
   (i)    A statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of
any crime, misdemeanor, or violation of any city ordinance, the nature of the
offense and the punishment or penalty assessed  therefor.
   (j)    A statement by a reputable physician of the City, dated not more than
ten days prior to  submission of the application, certifying the applicant to
be free of contagious, infectious or communicable disease.
   (k)    Proof that applicant is a citizen of the United States.
      (Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.03  BOND REQUIRED.
   Every applicant, who is not an elector of the City, shall file with the City
Manager a surety bond or cash bond, running to the City in the amount of not
less than five hundred dollars ($500.00) nor more than one thousand dollars
($1,000) as determined by the Manager with surety acceptable to and approved by
the Manager, conditioned that the applicant shall comply fully with all the
ordinances of the City and the State statutes regulating palmistry, phrenology
or telling of fortunes by any manner whatsoever.
(Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.04  LICENSE ELIGIBILITY.
   No license shall be issued to any person who is not a citizen of the United
States or who does not possess a good moral character.
(Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.05  LICENSE INVESTIGATION.
   The City Manager shall cause an investigation to be made as to the
qualifications of the applicant as herein provided and if it appears that the
applicant possesses such qualifications, shall grant a license, but if it does
not so appear, shall reject the application.
(Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.06  LICENSE TERMINATION; FEE; EXHIBITION; REVOCATION.
   (a)    Termination; Fee.  Each license shall terminate annually on December
31 in the year when issued and no such license shall issue until applicant
thereof shall have paid to the City Manager for credit to the General Fund the
sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00); provided that any license issued after
April 1 shall be prorated on a quarterly basis.
   (b)    Exhibition.  All persons holding a license under this chapter shall
exhibit such license at the request of any citizen, or any officer of the
City. 
   (c)    Revocation.
      (1)    The City Manager may temporarily revoke any license issued under
this chapter, without hearing for a period not to exceed ten days.
      (2)    The Manager may permanently revoke any license issued under this
chapter after notice and hearing for any of the following causes:
         A.    Fraud, misrepresentation or false statement contained in the
application for license;
         B.    Fraud, misrepresentation or false statement made in the course
of carrying on his business;
         C.    Any violation of this chapter;
         D.    Conviction of any crime or misdemeanor involving moral
turpitude; or
         E.    Conducting the business in an unlawful manner or in such manner
as to constitute a breach of peace or to constitute a menace to the health,
safety or general welfare of the public.
      (3)    Notice of the hearing for permanent revocation of a license shall
be given in writing,  setting forth the grounds of complaint and the time and
place of hearing. Notice shall be delivered personally to licensee or be
mailed, postage prepaid, to the licensee at the  address shown on his
application at least five days prior to the date set for hearing. Failure of
licensee to appear at the hearing shall constitute an admission of the
complaint.
      (4)    Upon notice of either temporary or permanent revocation of the
license, the licensee shall surrender his license to the City Manager.
         (Ord. 1479. Passed 8-6-62.)
   717.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which an offense occurs or continues.
CHAPTER 719
Massage Establishment
719.01   Definitions.
719.02   License required.
719.03   Exemptions.
719.04   Establishment license application, issuance and renewal.
719.05   Technician license application, issuance and renewal.
719.06   Maintenance of records required.
719.07   Suspension or revocation of licenses.
719.08   Facilities necessary.
719.09   Operating requirements.
719.10   Inspections.
719.11   Employment of minor prohibited.
719.12   Identification card.
719.13   Display of licenses.
719.14   Transfer of licenses.
719.15   Employment.
719.16   Maintaining a public nuisance.
719.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Unlawful advertising  - see GEN. OFF.
 533.14
   719.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following words shall have the meaning
ascribed to them as hereafter set forth:
   (a)    "Employee" means any person other than the massage technician, who
renders any service to the operator and who receives compensation directly from
the operator.
   (b)    "Massage establishment" means any establishment having a fixed place
of business where any person, firm, association or corporation engages in,
carries on or permits to be engaged in or carried on any of the activities
defined in subsection (c) hereof for any consideration whatsoever.
   (c)    "Massage" means any method of pressure on or friction against or
stroking, kneading, rubbing, tapping, pounding, vibrating or stimulating of the
external soft parts of the body with the hands or with the aid of any
mechanical or electrical apparatus or appliance, with or without such
supplementary aids as rubbing alcohol, liniments, antiseptics, oils, powders,
creams, lotions, ointments or other similar preparations commonly used in this
practice for a purpose other than the treatment of disorders of the human body.
   (d)    "Massage technician" means any person who, for any consideration
whatsoever, engages in the practice of massage as defined in subsection (c)
hereof.
   (e)    "Operator" means the operator of a licensed massage establishment.
   (f)    "Person" means any individual or any legal entity established in
accordance with the laws of the State of Ohio or properly registered to do
business in the State of Ohio.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.02  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)    No person shall engage in, offer or advertise the operation of a
massage establishment as defined in this chapter, unless such massage
establishment is licensed under this chapter.
   (b)    No person shall engage in the business of or be employed as a massage
technician in the City unless he or she has obtained a license under this
chapter.
   (c)    No person shall engage in, offer or advertise massage services in any
locations other than a licensed massage establishment.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.03  EXEMPTIONS.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to the following:
   (a)    Hospitals, nursing homes and a medical treatment facility regulated
by the State of Ohio Medical Board;
   (b)    A person licensed or registered by the State of Ohio Medical Board
while performing their licensed or registered profession;
   (c)    A licensed cosmetologist, registered barber, registered barber
apprentice,  licensed chiropractor, licensed practical nurse or registered
nurse, and registered physical therapist, while performing their licensed or
registered profession; and
   (d)    A person working under the direct supervision of individuals or
establishments mentioned in this section while performing their licensed or
registered profession.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.04  ESTABLISHMENT LICENSE APPLICATION, ISSUANCE AND RENEWAL.
   (a)    A person desiring to operate a massage establishment shall make
application to
the City upon forms prescribed by the department. Each application shall
include a filing fee of three hundred dollars ($300.00) which shall be
nonrefundable. The application shall set forth the following information:
      (1)    In the event that the applicant is an individual, the name,
residence address and social security number of the applicant and of each
proposed employee and massage technician to be employed by the applicant;
      (2)    In the event that the applicant is a corporation, partnership or
nonprofit association, the name, position, residence address and social
security number of the managing agent or employee of the applicant;
      (3)    The principal place of business of the applicant and the address
of the proposed massage establishment, if different from the principal place of
business;
      (4)    The name, residence address and social security number of each
proposed employee and massage technician to be employed by the applicant;
      (5)    The business, occupation and employment of the applicant for a
three-year period preceding the date of application; and
      (6)    Whether the applicant has been convicted of, plead no contest to,
or suffered a forfeiture on a bond involving a charge of committing any crime,
except minor traffic violations, within the last five years. If the answer is
in the affirmative, a statement shall be made giving the place and the court in
which such conviction, plea or forfeiture was had, the specific charge under
which the conviction, plea or forfeiture was obtained, and the sentence imposed
as a result thereof.
   (b)    The applicant and or licensee, within three business days, shall
provide the City with any changes or corrections of the required information
set forth in subsection (a), along with the date of the effective change.
   (c)    The application for a license in accordance with this Chapter shall
include a signed statement acknowledging that the applicant has a copy of
Section
719.01 to
719.99 and understands the requirements of operating a massage establishment in
the City.
   (d)    Upon application and within a reasonable time, the City shall conduct
an investigation regarding the provided information in the application. No
license shall issue for any establishment or to any applicant that has provided
information that is materially false, incomplete, or misleading. No license
shall issue to any person or applicant:
      (1)    That the establishment, as proposed by the applicant, is not in
compliance with another provision of law, including building code(s), zoning
restrictions, and the additional restrictions contained in this chapter;
      (2)    That the applicant has been convicted within the last five years
of a felony; an offense involving sexual misconduct with children; keeping or
residing in a house of ill fame; solicitation of a lewd or unlawful act;
prostitution; pandering; or any crime  involving dishonesty, fraud or deceit.
   (e)    A massage establishment license issued pursuant to this chapter shall
terminate at the expiration of one year from the date of its issuance.
   (f)   A massage establishment license issued pursuant to this chapter may be
renewed by the filing of a renewal application by the current holder of the
license with the City upon such forms that he may prescribe not later than
thirty days prior to the expiration date of the license. A renewal application
shall be accompanied by a renewal fee in the amount of one hundred dollars
($100.00).
   (g)    The issuance of a license pursuant to this section shall not exempt
the applicant from obtaining a massage technician license pursuant to this
chapter in the event that the applicant intends to personally provide massage
services.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.05  TECHNICIAN LICENSE APPLICATION, ISSUANCE AND RENEWAL.
   (a)    A person desiring to perform services as a massage technician shall
make application to the City upon such forms as may be prescribed by the
License Inspector. Each application shall include a filing fee of seventy-five
dollars ($75.00) which shall be nonrefundable. In addition, the applicant must
submit results of an Ohio Bureau of Criminal Investigation fingerprint
background check. The application shall contain the following information:
      (1)   Name, residence address and social security number of the
applicant;
      (2)    The name of the massage establishment owner or operator for whom
the massage technician is employed;
      (3)    A physical description setting forth the applicant's weight,
height, hair  color and color of eyes;
      (4)    A recent two-inch by two-inch photograph of the applicant and a
set of fingerprints which may be obtained from the Police Department;
      (5)    A certified copy of the applicant's birth certificate which
evidences that the applicant is at least eighteen years of age;
      (6)    The business, occupation and employment of the applicant for a
three-year period preceding the date of application; and
      (7)    Whether the applicant has been convicted of, plead no contest to,
or suffered a forfeiture on a bond involving a charge of committing any crime,
except minor traffic violations, within the last five years. If the answer is
in the affirmative, a statement shall be made giving the place and the court in
which such conviction, plea or forfeiture was had, the specific charge under
which the conviction, plea or forfeiture was obtained, and the sentence imposed
as a result thereof.
   (b)    Upon application, the City shall provide to the applicant a copy of
this chapter and shall obtain a signed acknowledgement from the applicant
acknowledging receipt thereof.
   (c)    Upon application, the City shall conduct or have conducted an
investigation into the information contained on the application. The City shall
issue a license to engage in the business of or be employed as a massage
technician to the applicant unless the City finds:
      (1)    That the applicant has been convicted within the last five years
of a felony; any offense involving sexual misconduct with children; keeping or
residing in a house of ill fame; solicitation of a lewd or unlawful act;
prostitution; pandering; or any crime involving dishonesty, fraud or deceit.
   (d)    A massage technician license issued pursuant to this chapter shall
terminate at the expiration of one year from the date of its issuance.
   (e)    A massage technician license issued pursuant to this chapter may be
renewed by the filing of a renewal application by the current holder of the
license with the City upon such forms that he may prescribe not later than
thirty days prior to the expiration date of the license. A renewal application
shall be accompanied by a renewal fee in the amount of seventy-five dollars
($75.00).
   (f)    The issuance of a license pursuant to this section shall not exempt
the applicant from obtaining a massage establishment license pursuant to this
chapter in the event that the applicant intends to operate a massage
establishment.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.06  MAINTENANCE OF RECORDS REQUIRED.
   The owner or operator of a massage establishment shall maintain a customer
log showing the name, date, service and dollar amount for each customer served
by the establishment.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.07  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSES.
   (a)    The City Manager may revoke or suspend any license issued under this
chapter where it appears that the operator or massage technician has been
convicted of any offense which would be cause for denial of a license upon an
original application, has made a false statement on an application for a
license, has committed an act in violation of this chapter or has otherwise
failed to comply or maintain compliance with the requirements of this chapter.
   (b)    The City Manager, in revoking or suspending a massage establishment
license or massage technician license, shall give the licensee a written notice
specifying the grounds therefor.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.08  FACILITIES NECESSARY.
   (a)    No massage establishment shall be issued a license, nor be operated,
established or maintained in the City, unless an inspection by the Stark County
Health Department, Building Inspector and Fire Inspector, or their
representatives, reveals that the establishment complies with each of the
following minimum requirements:
      (1)   Construction of rooms used for toilets, tubs, steam baths and
showers shall be made waterproof with approved waterproof materials and shall
be installed in accordance with applicable building code.
      (2)    All massage tables, bathtubs, shower stalls and steam or bath
areas and floors shall have surfaces which may be readily disinfected;
      (3)    Adequate bathing, dressing and locker facilities shall be provided
for the patrons to be served at any given time. In the event male and female
patrons are to be served simultaneously, separate bathing, dressing, locker and
massage room facilities  shall be provided;
      (4)    The premises shall have adequate equipment for disinfection and
sterilizing nondisposable instruments and materials used in administering
massages. Such nondisposable instruments and materials shall be disinfected
after use on each patron;
      (5)    Closed cabinets shall be provided and used for the storage of
linen, towels and other materials used in connection with administering
massages. All soiled linens, towels and other materials shall be kept in
properly covered containers or cabinets, which containers or cabinets shall be
kept separate from the clean storage area;
      (6)    Toilet facilities shall be provided in convenient locations. When
employees and patrons of different sexes are on the premises at the same time,
separate toilet facilities shall be provided for each sex. A single water
closet per sex shall be provided for each twenty or more employees or patrons
of that sex on the premises at any one time. Urinals may be substituted for
water closets after one closet has been provided. Toilets shall be designated
as to the sex accommodated therein;
      (7)    Lavatories or wash basins provided with both hot and cold running
water shall be installed in either the toilet room or a vestibule immediately
adjacent thereto. Lavatories or wash basins shall be provided with soap and a
dispenser and with single use sanitary towels;
      (8)    The premises shall be equipped with a service sink for custodial
services; and
      (9)    The premises shall meet the requirements of the Building Code,
Fire Prevention Code and the following health codes:
         A.   No person who is affected with any disease in a communicable form
or is a carrier of such disease shall work in any massage parlor and no owner
or operator of such establishment shall employ any person suspected of being
infected with any disease in a communicable form or of being a carrier of such
disease. If the owner or operator suspects that any employee has contracted any
disease in a communicable form or has become a carrier of such disease,  he
shall notify the Health Commissioner immediately.
         B.   The Health Commissioner or a physician authorized by him may
examine and take a careful morbidity history of every person connected with a
massage parlor, or about to be employed whose work bring him in contact with a
patron. If such examination or history suggests that such person may be a
carrier of or infected with the organisms of tuberculosis, typhoid or
paratyphoid fever or any other communicable diseases likely to be transmitted
by contact, he shall secure appropriate specimens of body discharges and cause
them to be examined in a laboratory approved by him or by the State health
authorities for such examinations, and if the results justify such person shall
be barred from such employment. Such person shall furnish such information,
submit to such physical examination and submit such laboratory specimens as the
Health Commissioner may require for the purpose of determining freedom of
infection.
         C.   No place shall be used, maintained or permitted to be used or
maintained as a place where massaging is done for pay unless all of the
following requirements are complied with:
            1.   Every such place shall be supplied with running hot and cold
water.
            2.    No vessel, utensil, instrument, towel, cloth or other article
coming in contact with the skin of any person in the process of massaging shall
be used until after it has been sterilized, and no sponge, powder puff or other
articles that are not so sterilized shall be used in any such process. No alum
or other material for stopping the flow of blood shall be used, except in
powdered or liquid form in any such process.
            3.    No room where massaging is done shall be used for sleeping
purposes, and no furniture adapted for sleeping room purposes shall be in any
such room.
            4.    Every such place and all furniture, fixtures and equipment in
such place shall be maintained in a clean condition at all times.
         D.   The Stark County Health Department, the applicable building
inspector and the Fire Inspector shall certify that the proposed massage
establishment complies with all the requirements of this section and shall send
such certification to the City Planning Department.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-
14.)
   719.09  OPERATING REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)    Every portion of the massage establishment, including appliances and
apparatus, shall be kept clean and operated in a sanitary condition.
   (b)    Price rates for all services shall be prominently posted in the
reception area in a location available to all prospective customers.
   (c)    The operator and all employees, including massage technicians, shall
be clean and wear clean, nontransparent outer garments, covering the sexual and
genital areas, and which use is restricted to the massage establishment. A
separate dressing room for each sex shall be available on the premises and each
dressing room shall contain a tub or shower in good working order and
individual lockers for each employee and customer. Doors to such dressing rooms
shall open inward and shall be self-closing.
   (d)    All massage establishments shall be provided with clean, laundered
sheets and towels in sufficient quantity and these shall be laundered after
each use thereof and stored in a sanitary manner.
   (e)    The sexual or genital areas of patrons shall be covered by towels,
cloths or undergarments when in the presence of the operator, an employee or
massage technician.
   (f)    No person, knowingly, in a massage establishment shall place his or
her hand upon, touch with any part of his or her body, fondle in any manner or
massage a sexual or genital area of any other person.
   (g)    No massage technician, employee or operator shall perform or offer or
agree to perform any act which would require the touching of the patron's
genital area.
   (h)    All walls, ceilings, floors, pools, showers, bathtubs, steam rooms
and other physical facilities shall be in good repair and maintained in a clean
and sanitary condition. Wet and dry heat rooms, steam or vapor rooms or steam
or vapor cabinets, shower compartments and toilet rooms shall be thoroughly
cleaned and disinfected each day the business is in operation. Bathtubs and
showers shall be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected after each use. When
carpeting is used on the floors, it shall be kept dry.
   (i)    Oils, creams, lotions or other preparations used in administering
massages shall be kept in clean, closed containers or cabinets.
   (j)   Eating in the massage work areas shall not be permitted. Animals shall
not be permitted in the massage work areas.
   (k)    Each massage technician shall wash his or her hands in hot running
water, using a proper soap or disinfectant before administering a massage to
each patron.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.10  INSPECTIONS.
   The Chief of Police and the Stark County Health Department. or their
representatives, shall from time to time and at least twice a year, make an
inspection of each massage establishment granted a permit under the provisions
of this chapter for the purposes of determining that the provisions of this
chapter are complied with. Such inspections shall be made at reasonable times
and in a reasonable manner. No licensee shall fail to allow such inspection
officer access to the premises or hinder such officer in any manner.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.11  EMPLOYMENT OF MINOR PROHIBITED.
   No owner, proprietor, manager or other person in charge of any massage
establishment shall employ any person who is not at least eighteen years of
age.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.12  IDENTIFICATION CARD.
   The City shall provide each licensed massage technician an identification
card which shall contain a photograph of the person and the full name and
license number assigned to such person, which shall be worn on the front of the
outermost garment at all times during the hours of operation of any
establishment granted a licensed pursuant to this chapter.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.13  DISPLAY OF LICENSES.
   Every licensee shall display a valid license in a conspicuous place within
the massage establishment so that the same may be readily seen by persons upon
entering the premises.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.14  TRANSFER OF LICENSES.
   No licenses issued pursuant to the provisions of this chapter shall be
transferable except with a written consent of the City Manager and approval of
the Stark County Health Department.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.15  EMPLOYMENT.
   No operator of a massage establishment shall employ any person as a massage
technician unless such person has first obtained a valid license pursuant to
this chapter.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.16  MAINTAINING A PUBLIC NUISANCE.
   Any building used as a massage establishment in violation of this chapter
with the intentional, knowing, reckless or negligent permission of the owner
thereof, or the agent of the owner managing the building, together with all
fixtures and other property used in violation of this chapter, is hereby
declared to be a nuisance.  (Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)
   719.99  PENALTY.
   Every person, except those persons who are specifically exempted by this
chapter, whether acting as an individual, owner, employee of the owner,
operator or employee of the operator, or whether acting as a mere helper for
the owner, employee or operator, or acting as a participant or worker in any
way, who gives massages or conducts a massage establishment without first
obtaining licenses from the City, or who violates any of the provisions of this
chapter, is guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree.
(Ord. 14-19.  Passed 5-5-14.)

521.09
   721.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall commence to drill a well for oil or gas
or operate a producing well within the corporate limits of the City, except
pursuant to a permit issued by the City Manager, as provided in this chapter. 
Each well shall require a separate permit.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.02  PERMIT APPLICATION; FEE.
   Any person, firm or corporation desiring to engage in the drilling of a well
for oil or gas, or to carry on the operation of an oil or gas well, within the
corporate limits of the City, shall make application to the City Manager upon
such forms as may be prescribed for a permit to do so.  Such application shall
be accompanied by a fee of one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500).  A
separate application and fee shall be filed for each well contemplated.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.03  PERMIT FEE NOT REFUNDABLE.
   No refund of any permit fee or part thereof shall be returned for a dry hole
or for failure to exercise the privilege to drill upon a site covered by the
permit.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.04  MAP REQUIRED.
   At the time of presenting the application, the applicant shall supply and
attach to the application a map showing the exact location of the proposed well
and sludge pit and the location of the storage tank, batteries and access road
if there is a producing well.  The map shall remain on file with the City
Manager for future reference.  The map shall be to scale and show the lot lines
of all properties in the area utilized for the well, the location of buildings
and structures in the unit, and the names of the owners of each property within
the drilling unit shall be shown on the map.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.05  COPIES OF EASEMENTS REQUIRED.
   Each application shall have attached with it copies of any existing
easements or options for easements for pipe lines and/or storage tanks if there
is a producing well.  The copy of the easement shall be accompanied by a map
showing where the same crosses private property.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.06  INVESTIGATION OF PREMISES.
   (a)   The City Manager shall make an investigation of the premises for which
such permit is sought.
   (b)   When the investigation required by this section is completed, the
application, together with a written report of the investigation, shall be
submitted to Council, which shall grant a permit if it finds from the
investigation and the application that such application complies in all
respects with the terms of this chapter; otherwise, Council shall reject such
application.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.07  PERMIT REFUSAL.
   Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, Council has the right
to reject any application for a permit where by reason of the location of the
proposed well and the character and value of the permanent improvements already
erected, and the use to which the land and surroundings are adapted for civic
purposes, or for sanitary reasons, the drilling of an oil or gas well shall
constitute a serious disadvantage to the City and its inhabitants.  Council
shall also not be required to consider the issuance or denial of prior
applications for permits in making its decision to grant or not to grant an
application for permit.  When a permit is refused, the fee deposited with the
application shall be returned to the applicant.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.08  INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   Upon affirmative vote by a majority vote of Council that a permit shall be
issued, the City Manager shall issue the same only if there is submitted to the
City Manager a certificate of insurance covering the applicant's liability for
property damage and personal injury in the amount of not less than one million
dollars ($1,000,000) with an annual aggregate limit of two million dollars
($2,000,000) which policy shall remain in effect and be maintained by the
applicant until the well is plugged and pulled.  The insurance policy shall
specifically include liability coverage for the applicant covering the drilling
and the operation of the well including liability coverage for blowout and
crater in the drilling of the well.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.09  LAND OWNERSHIP.
   No permit shall be issued for the drilling of a well except upon ground
owned by the applicant or held under an oil and gas lease or drilling contract
from the owner, giving the owner's permission to drill the well.  Nothing
contained in this chapter, nor any permit issued hereunder, shall be deemed to
grant any right or license to the permittee to enter upon or occupy, in any
respect, in the drilling or production operations, any land not owned by him
except by the written permission of the owner.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.10  DRILLING REGULATIONS; LOCATION AND TIME LIMIT.
   (a)   No permit shall be issued to drill an oil or gas well unless the
proposed well, sludge pit, storage tanks and other installations or equipment
used at oil and gas wells are located:
      (1)   In a designated I-2 Industrial Manufacturing and Storage District
under the Zoning Ordinance presently in force and hereafter amended.
      (2)   Upon a tract or drilling unit containing not less than forty acres
which forty-acre tract  shall only include acreage designated as an I-
2 Industrial Manufacturing and Storage  District under the City Zoning
Ordinance.
      (3)   Not less than 1,000 feet from any well drilling to producing from
or capable of producing from same pool.
      (4)   Not less than 600 feet from a boundary of any designated
residential zoning district.
      (5)   Not less than 500 feet from a boundary line of the subject tract or
drilling.
      (6)   Not less than 250 feet from any building designed for human
occupancy or building where the public assembles or congregates.
      (7)   Not less than 150 feet from any road, highway, street or alley and
not nearer than fifty  feet to a railroad tract.
   (b)   All permittees shall provide a twenty-five thousand dollar ($25,000)
road bond which shall be placed with the City Finance Director to insure that
all roads are properly improved from any damage incurred from the drilling of
the oil or gas well.  Bond shall remain in effect until the City Manager has
determined that all damage to roads has been corrected to his satisfaction.
   (c)   When a permit required by Section 721.01 has been issued, the same
shall terminate and become inoperative, without any action on the part of the
City unless, within ninety days from the date of issue, actual drilling of the
well has commenced, and after the drilling of a well has commenced, the
cessation for a like period of the drilling operations, shall cause the
termination and cancellation of the permit and the well shall be deemed
abandoned for all purposes of this section, and thereafter, no person shall
drill or operate any such well without the issuance of another permit.
   (d)   A permit issued pursuant to the ordinances and regulations provided
for by the City shall not be transferable.  It may, however, be reissued as a
new permit to a successive owner.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.11  EMERGENCY NAME AND NUMBER.
   The permittee shall supply to the Chief of Police the names, addresses and
telephone numbers of the persons responsible for the operation and maintenance
of the well for which a permit is issued so that some responsible person may be
reached at any time in case of an emergency; the information shall be posted at
the well site.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.12  FENCES.
   A permittee shall maintain a temporary fence around the drilling site in
accordance with good oil field practice.  Should a well be a producer, the
permittee shall, upon completion of the well, construct a fence around the well
pump and tank batteries, separators, drainage pits and other installations or
equipment used at oil well installations within the corporate limits of the
City.  Such fences shall be chain link, six feet in height with three strands
of barbed wire at the top and shall be maintained in good repair.  Locking
devices shall be used on the tank valves and a locked gate shall be placed on
the tank stairway.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.13  POLLUTION CONTROL.
   No waste, sludge, water or effluents of any type where an oil well is being
drilled or operated shall in any manner be emptied or drained into any storm or
sanitary sewer of the City, or in any open watercourse.  All sludge shall be
confined to a pit during the drilling period and after completion shall be
covered to the original ground level, except a small pit for water overflow.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.14  MUD AT DRILLING SITE.
   All permittees shall use care at a drilling site to keep the area around
such drilling site free of mud which will be carried on the public streets by
any vehicle or other equipment used at the drilling site.  Should any mud be
carried on the public street from a drilling site, the permittee may be
required to clean up the street to the satisfaction of the City Manager.  The
City Manager shall have the authority to request a permittee to take specific
steps to reduce mud at any given location.  Failure of a permittee to clean up
the public streets to the satisfaction of the City Manager, or failure to take
steps to reduce mud at a given location as requested by the City Manager shall
be grounds for revocation of a permit and shall further be a misdemeanor set
forth in Section 721.99.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.15  PUMP OR MOTOR NOISE.
   Well pumps may be operated with gasoline motors, provided the motors are
properly muffled to reduce noise to a minimum and where such gasoline motors
are not properly muffled, Council may require electric motors for the well
pump.  In the determination of what constitutes a properly muffled gasoline
motor, the decision of Council shall be final.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.16  EQUIPMENT PAINTING SCHEDULE.
   All equipment, including tanks, shall be painted at the time of installing
and every two years thereafter.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.17  DAMAGE; MAINTENANCE AND RESTORATION OF PROPERTY; LIABILITY.
   The permittee shall restore the streets, sidewalks, municipal utilities and
other public places of the City, which may have been damaged or disturbed in
the operations of drilling or preparing to drill, or connected with drilling,
to their former condition.
   The permittee shall clear the area of all litter, rubbish, machinery,
derricks, building, oil or other substances used or allied to the use of
drilling or producing operations, when such machinery or materials are no
longer necessary for drilling operations or maintenance of the well.  In
addition, all drainage pits used in the maintenance of the well shall be lined
with polyethylene or similar material to prevent seepage.  The pit shall be
kept free of sludge and other objectionable substances and shall be maintained
in a reasonably dry and clean condition.
   The permittee shall pay to the owners of any realty, crops, building
improvements, goods or chattels located in the area, except persons who are
parties to the drilling unit, any extra cost of insurance on such property
imposed by reason of granting of the permit to the operations carried
thereunder.  The permittee shall hold the City free and harmless from any and
all liability growing out of the granting of the permit.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.18  DIKE REQUIRED.
   Before any oil is stored in any aboveground storage tanks, there shall be
constructed completely around all such tanks a dike or earthen fill of well
compacted earth of sufficient capacity in a proper manner in accordance with
good oil field practice.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.19  WATER WELL PROTECTION.
   The permittee shall seal gas and oil wells to protect fresh water from salt
pollution in a proper manner in accordance with good oil field practice.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.20  GAS FLARING.
   Flares are not permitted on oil and gas wells in the City.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.21  FIRE EXTINGUISHER; MUFFLER.
   All drilling rigs shall be provided with a fire extinguisher of not less
than twenty pounds, dry chemical, and all motors shall be provided with a
muffler which shall be of sufficient capacity to reduce the noise of motors to
a minimum.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.22  EQUIPMENT PROHIBITED WITHOUT PERMIT.
   No material, drilling rigs or other equipment shall be placed upon any
drilling site until all necessary permits have been obtained in accordance with
City ordinances and the laws of Ohio.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.23  ADDITIONAL COMPLIANCE.
   All permittees shall, in addition to the regulations set forth herein,
comply with all statutes, rules and regulations promulgated by any department
or division of the State relative to the drilling, operation, maintenance,
pulling and plugging of oil and gas wells.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.24  RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   Council or its representatives shall have the authority at any time to enter
upon property where a drilling site is contemplated, or in the process of being
drilled, for the purpose of inspecting the site and equipment and any and all
other things necessary to assure compliance with the provisions of this
chapter.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.25  PERMIT REVOCATION; APPEAL.
   (a)   Failure to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall be
grounds to refuse a permit to drill a well or to revoke a permit already
issued.  Revocation of this permit shall remove the right of the permittee to
drill or operate for oil or gas until such permittee has complied with the
provisions of this chapter.  Operations carried on by the permittee after the
revocation of the permit shall be a misdemeanor, punishable under Section
721.99.
   (b)   The City Manager is hereby granted the authority to cancel and revoke
any permit when it appears that fraud or misrepresentation was practiced in
obtaining a permit, or that the permittee has failed to comply with the terms
of this chapter after notice of any violation thereof.  An appeal from the
decision of the City Manager to revoke a permit shall be made with Council,
which shall have the authority and power to review revocations.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.26  ABANDONING WELLS.
   In the event that a well is abandoned, the permittee, owner or lessee shall
notify the City Manager of such abandonment before the well has been abandoned
and the equipment removed.  All permittees shall be required to plug or pull a
well site for abandonment and remove any and all ground appurtenances and
return ground to its original grade and condition, and to follow any other
rules and regulations promulgated by any department or division of the State
relative to pulling, plugging and abandoning oil and gas wells.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
   721.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter or any amendment
hereafter adopted shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
A separate offense shall be deemed each day during or on which a violation
occurs or continues.
(Ord. 93-08.  Passed 3-1-93.)
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________
CHAPTER 725
Plumbers
725.01   Sanitary plumbing; license required.
725.02   Granting of license; revocation.
725.03   License.
725.04   Exhibition and evidence of license.
725.05   Transfer of license prohibited.
725.06   Operating under the license  of another prohibited.
725.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Power to license plumbers - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
         Sewer tapping - see S.U. & P.S.
939.01,
943.03
   725.01  SANITARY PLUMBING; LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No sanitary plumbing shall be done in the City except by properly qualified
plumbers holding a license therefor issued pursuant to resolution of Council
and signed by the City Manager, which license shall be conditioned upon the
holder's obedience to the rules regulating plumbing in the City. All sanitary
plumbing work shall be done so as to conform in all respects to the ordinances
and rules and regulations of the City and its several departments and to the
laws of the State.
(Ord. 1108. Passed 2-17-58.)
   725.02  GRANTING OF LICENSE; REVOCATION.
   A license to do sanitary plumbing in the City shall be granted by resolution
of Council to any person, firm or corporation who furnishes evidence
satisfactory to Council that he is a properly qualified plumber. The license
may be revoked and canceled by Council at any time for a neglect or refusal to
comply with any of the ordinances, rules, regulations and laws governing
plumbing; provided, however, that such license shall be revoked only after due
notice to the holder thereof, fixing the time and place of hearing by the
Council. Such license when authorized by Council shall be issued and signed by
the City Manager under such authority.
(Ord. 1108. Passed 2-17-58.)
   725.03  LICENSE.
   Before any license to do sanitary plumbing shall issue, the applicant shall
pay to the City Manager a fee for the issuance of such license for a period of
one calendar year or remaining fraction thereof; except when the holder of a
license, valid for the preceding calendar year, shall make application for
renewal thereof and tender the required license fee, and shall be required to
pay a fee for the calendar year or fraction thereof. A renewal of a plumber's
license may be made by the City Manager without resolution of Council if the
application therefor is made while the holder has a valid unexpired and
unrevoked license.
(Ord. 05-56.  Passed 12-19-05.)
   725.04  EXHIBITION AND EVIDENCE OF LICENSE.
   Any person, firm or corporation which holds a plumber's license shall, upon
request by the City Manager, Council, Building Inspector or Police, produce
satisfactory evidence that the licensee is the one actually performing the
sanitary plumbing.
(Ord. 1108. Passed 2-17-58.)
   725.05  TRANSFER OF LICENSE PROHIBITED.
   No person, firm or corporation which holds a plumber's license shall permit
any other person, firm or corporation to perform any sanitary plumbing under
authority of its license. (Ord. 1108. Passed 2-17-58.)
   725.06  OPERATING UNDER THE LICENSE OF ANOTHER PROHIBITED.
   No person, firm or corporation not licensed by the City shall perform any
sanitary plumbing under authority of a license issued to another person, firm
or corporation.
(Ord. 1108. Passed 2-17-58.)
   725.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which an offense occurs or continues.

CHAPTER 729
Public Dances
729.01   License required; further regulations.
729.02   Fee and duration of license.
729.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate dancing academies or public ballrooms - see Ohio R. C.
715.61
      Human endurance contests - see Ohio R. C. 3773.14
      Permit required for public dancing - see Ohio R. C. 3773.19
      Intoxicating liquor in dance hall - see Ohio R. C. 4399.14
      Inducing panic - see GEN. OFF.
509.06
      Disorderly conduct - see GEN. OFF.
509.03
      Curfew for minors - see GEN. OFF.
527.01
   729.01  LICENSE REQUIRED; FURTHER REGULATIONS.
   No person shall hold, sponsor or conduct any public dance for private gain
without first obtaining a license from the City Manager. Such licensee shall
prevent such dance from continuing later than 12:00 a.m. midnight; shall
prevent the presence of any intoxicating liquor or any intoxicated person at
the place of the dance; shall prevent the presence at such dance of all persons
under the age of fourteen years unless accompanied by a father, mother or legal
guardian; and shall give free access at all times to any law enforcement
officer for inspection and regulation.
(1950 Code §246; Ord. 1688. Passed 1-18-65.)
   729.02  FEE AND DURATION OF LICENSE.
   The City Manager has authority to grant and issue a license to hold, sponsor
or conduct any public dance provided for in this chapter upon the payment of
license fee therefor in the sum of thirty-five dollars ($35.00). The license
shall expire on December 31 of the year in which issued and the full license
fee will be required of licensee annually irrespective of the date of issue of
such license, provided however, that the license shall be revocable by the City
Manager for violation of any ordinance governing such dance or when he shall
find it necessary to do so in order to preserve the public peace and morals.
(1950 Code §247; Ord. 1688. Passed 1-18-65.)
   729.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which an offense occurs or continues.

CHAPTER 733
Taxicabs
733.01   Definitions.
733.02   Operator’s license required.
733.03   Application and fee for license.
733.04   Revocation of operator’s license.
733.05   License required; application; expiration or revocation.
733.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate taxicabs - see Ohio R. C. 715.22, 715.66
      Operation and equipment - see
TRAFFIC CODE
      Use of taxicab stands - see TRAF.
351.10
      Power to establish stands and fix rates - see Ohio R. C. 715.25; TRAF.
305.04
   733.01  DEFINITIONS.
   Unless otherwise expressly stated when used in this chapter, the following
terms mean:
   (a)    "Taxicab operator" means and includes every person, firm,
corporation, partnership, association or like agency which owns, controls,
operates, maintains or manages a taxicab or taxicabs in the City.
   (b)    "Taxicab" means and includes any motor driven vehicle used in the
City to carry passengers for hire, or for which service any remuneration is
paid or accepted, except motor busses operated on  regular schedules, and
except vehicles used in what is commonly termed a "share a ride"arrangement
operating by prearrangement over a regularly traveled route.
   (c)    "Taxicab driver" means any person who drives a taxicab in the City
other than the owner thereof.
      (1950 Code §225.)
   733.02  OPERATOR'S LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall operate a taxicab within the City without first obtaining a
license therefor from the City Manager as hereinafter provided.
(1950 Code §225.)
   733.03  APPLICATION AND FEE FOR LICENSE.
   The City Manager, subject to the approval of Council, shall issue the
license required by Section 733.02 for each taxicab for a term not to exceed
twelve months, only when the applicant therefor shall have deposited with the
City Manager:
   (a)    A signed application showing the name and address of the owner, the
manufacturer's name, serial number, year, model, type of body construction and
maximum safe passenger capacity for taxicab;
   (b)    Evidence to the satisfaction of the City Manager that public
convenience and necessity requires the operation of such taxicab or taxicabs;
   (c)    Evidence to the satisfaction of the City Manager that the taxicab is
in a good and safe mechanical  condition, and that he has never suffered any
such license to be revoked;
(1950 Code §225 )
   (d)    Policy of liability insurance for the taxicab written by an insurance
company authorized to carry on business and write such policy in the State,
acceptable to the City Manager, which policy shall indemnify the taxi operator
in the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for injury to one person
and three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) for injury to more than one
person, and fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) property damage in any accident.
      (Ord. 82-64. Passed 9-20-82.)
   (e)    A fee of five dollars ($5.00) for each six months period or fraction
thereof, no part of which may be recoverable after such license is issued.
      (1950 Code §225.)
   733.04  REVOCATION OF OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   Such taxicab operator's license shall become void on each February 1 and
whenever the operator fails to maintain insurance at the level provided in
Section 733.03, and it may be revoked by order of the City Manager for the
operator's violation of any City ordinance, State or Federal law, and for
failure to keep the taxicab in a good and safe mechanical condition.
(1950 Code §225.)
   733.05  LICENSE REQUIRED; APPLICATION; EXPIRATION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)    License Required.  No person shall drive a taxicab within the City
unless the person has first obtained an operator's license from the City
Manager as hereinafter provided.
   (b)    Application.  The City Manager shall issue the license required by
subsection (a) hereof to a taxicab driver for a term not to exceed twelve
months, and only when the taxicab driver shall have deposited with the City
Manager:
      (1)    His signed application showing his name, address, age, date of
issuance of his current state driver's license;
      (2)    Evidence to the satisfaction of the City Manager that he is of
good reputation and that he has never suffered any such license to be revoked;
      (3)    A license fee of three dollars ($3.00) for each six months period
or fraction thereof, no part of which may be recoverable after the license is
issued.
   (c)    Expiration or Revocation.  A taxicab driver's license as required by
subsection (a) hereof shall become void on each February 1, and may be revoked
at any time by the City Manager for the driver's violation of any City
ordinance, State or Federal law.
(1950 Code, §225.)
   733.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00).
